data.title: Mollösund
data.meta_description:
Mollosund at Southwestern Orust was a fishing village back in the 1500s. During the period came herring fishermen from all over the country come here to catch and prepare the famous herring. A community grew and a church was built. 
	
	When the herring disappeared thirty years later, followed the poverty and the fishermen who remained in Mollosund was now forced to subsist by including ranching on the small island Mollön. 
	
	In the 1750s came the herring back. The population grew to 430 people. It opened many taverns, where people spent their money. Large amounts of tran boiled in trankokerierna. Tran is an oil extracted from herring and used in the past include lighting. 
	
	Eventually acquired better fishing boats for offshore fishing and they pulled up cod, mackerel and ling. Långan was salted and dried, suspended on wooden stands. Then it became "stockfish" Christmas buffets. 
	
	In the 1700s, houses were Mollosund red or unpainted and most of the houses there was a boathouse. On the main street near the harbor, street called because there is only one, you can walk and look at the beautiful skipper and fish dwellings from this time. 
	
	In the early 1900s, as most Mollosund 1,000 residents, making it one of the largest fishing villages. Today it is a popular summer resort. 
	
	Ivar Lo Johansson, who was Mollosund summer visitor for many years, said the following about the street: If I were a musician, I would compose Mollösundsgatans symphony, when the wind is whistling on this wonderful street, which I love. A great musical epic is you.
data.text:
Mollosund at Southwestern Orust was a fishing village back in the 1500s. During the period came herring fishermen from all over the country come here to catch and prepare the famous herring. A community grew and a church was built.

When the herring disappeared thirty years later, followed the poverty and the fishermen who remained in Mollosund was now forced to subsist by including ranching on the small island Mollön.

In the 1750s came the herring back. The population grew to 430 people. It opened many taverns, where people spent their money. Large amounts of tran boiled in trankokerierna. Tran is an oil extracted from herring and used in the past include lighting.

Eventually acquired better fishing boats for offshore fishing and they pulled up cod, mackerel and ling. Långan was salted and dried, suspended on wooden stands. Then it became "stockfish" Christmas buffets.

In the 1700s, houses were Mollosund red or unpainted and most of the houses there was a boathouse. On the main street near the harbor, street called because there is only one, you can walk and look at the beautiful skipper and fish dwellings from this time.

In the early 1900s, as most Mollosund 1,000 residents, making it one of the largest fishing villages. Today it is a popular summer resort.

Ivar Lo Johansson, who was Mollosund summer visitor for many years, said the following about the street: If I were a musician, I would compose Mollösundsgatans symphony, when the wind is whistling on this wonderful street, which I love. A great musical epic is you.
